title: There are more trees on earth than stars in the milky way.
Google runs on 5000 times more code than the original space shuttle
The state of Texas has its own power grid to avoid dealing with the US federal government.
93% of the Great Barrier Reef is now damaged by coral bleaching
The microcontroller inside a Macbook charger is about as powerful as the original Macintosh computer.
"The quick brown fox jumps over the lazy dog" is an English-language pangram—a phrase that contains all of the letters of the alphabet.
If you eat a teaspoon of sugar after eating something spicy, it will completely neutralize the heat.
It took Apollo 11, that's the spaceship that carried Neil Armstrong, Michael Collins and Buzz Aldrin to the moon in 1969, 4 days 6 hours and 45 minutes to get to the moon.
The White House held its first 4th of July party in 1801.
According to author Kenneth C. Davis, July 2nd is the real day of Independence, but it's celebrated on July 4th because that's when congress accepted Jefferson's declaration.
Guinness World Records says the oldest living person verified by original proof of birth is Misao Okawa, a 115-year-old Japanese woman.
All numbers from one through nine hundred ninety-nine does not have the letter "a" in it.
A day on Venus is longer than a year on Venus.
Scotland's national animal is the unicorn

The United Nations estimates that there are over three million shipwrecks on the ocean floors. Lost, destroyed, or deliberately sunk, these wrecks are of interest to divers, underwater archaeologists, and treasure hunters alike.
The band AC/Dc released its first album TNT in 1975
The $1,000 bill featured Grover Cleveland on the front and the words "One Thousand Dollars" on the reverse. It was printed as a small-size Federal Reserve Note in 1918.
The largest known black hole named "S5 0014+81" is 40 billion times heavier than our sun.
The book that the Statue of Liberty is a tabula ansata (a tablet evoking the law) upon which is inscribed the date of the American Declaration of Independence, July 4, 1776.
Between 25% and 33% of the population sneeze when exposed to light.
In just ONE second, Apple makes $1,997.
All 50 states are listed across the top of the Lincoln Memorial on the back of the $5 bill.
How many calories are in two stamps?
Did you know...
In ancient Rome, when a man testified in court he would swear on his testicles.
EMI stands for ' Electrical and Musical Instruments'.
It is impossible to lick your elbow.
China has more English speakers than the United States.
A Virginia law requires all bathtubs to be kept out in the yards, not inside the house.
The flea can jump 350 times its body length. It's like a human jumping the length of a football field.
Mexican free-tailed bats sometimes fly up to two miles high to feed or to catch tail-winds that carry them over long distances at speeds of more than 60 miles per hour.
Australia is the richest source of mineral sands in the world.
A donkey will sink in quicksand but a mule won't.
The sound of E.T. walking was made by someone squishing her hands in jelly.
In Hartford, Connecticut, it is illegal for a husband to kiss his wife on Sundays.
For every 230 cars that are made, 1 will be stolen.
One in fourteen women in America is a natural blonde. Only one in sixteen men is.
An average human loses about 200 head hairs per day.
In the 40's, the Bich pen was changed to Bic for fear that Americans would pronounce it 'Bitch.'
The average human brain has about 100 billion nerve cells.
In English, four is the only digit that has the same number of letters as its value.
The average human blinks their eyes 6,205,000 times each year.
The word 'lethologica' describes the state of not being able to remember the word you want.
Canada is the only country not to win a gold medal in the summer Olympic games while hosting the event.
One in ten people live on an island.
At birth a panda is smaller than a mouse and weighs about four ounces.
Dreamt is the only English word that ends in the letters 'mt.'
Nutmeg is extremely poisonous if injected intravenously.
Mr. Rogers was an ordained minister.
Human thigh bones are stronger than concrete.
A woodchuck breathes only 10 times in hibernation.
13% of Americans actually believe that some parts of the moon are made of cheese.
On average, 100 people choke to death on ball-point pens every year.
A cat's jaw cannot move sideways.
The skeleton of Jeremy Bentham is present at all important meetings of the University of London
An ostrich’s eye is bigger than its brain.
If you put a drop of liquor on a scorpion, it will instantly go mad and sting itself to death.
A jumbo jet uses 4,000 gallons of fuel to take off.
More people are afraid of spiders than death. Amazingly, few people are afraid of Champagne corks even though you are more likely to be killed by one than by a spider.
Because of heavy traffic congestion, Julius Caesar banned all wheeled vehicles from Rome during daylight hours.
The average person falls asleep in seven minutes.
The first female guest host of 'Saturday Night Live' was Candace Bergen.
Thirty-five percent of the people who use personal ads for dating are already married.
Certain fireflies emit a light so penetrating that it can pass through flesh and wood.
I is the most spoken word in the English language
President John F Kennedy could read 4 newspapers in 20 minutes.
The Declaration of Independence was written on hemp (marijuana) paper.
It takes more calories to eat a piece of celery than the celery has in it to begin with.
In honour if Johan Vaaler, inventor of the paper clip, a 221/2 paper clip was erected in Oslo, Norway.
Nepal is the only country that doesn’t have a rectangular flag.
Bookkeeper is the only word in the English language with three consecutive double letters.
A group of kangaroos is called a mob.
Every year 4 people in the UK die putting their trousers on.
In the United States, more Frisbee discs are sold each year than baseballs, basketballs, and footballs combined.
The caterpillars of some Snout Moths (Pyralididae) live in or on water-plants.
IBM’s motto is 'Think'. Apple later made their motto 'Think different'.
The catfish has over 27000 taste buds (more than any other animal)
Children grow faster in the springtime.
Albert Einstein and Charles Darwin both married their first cousins
Scotland has more redheads than any other part of the world.
Alabama was the first state to recognize Christmas as an official holiday.
Lithuania has the highest suicide rate in the world.
Your stomach has to produce a new layer of mucus every two weeks or it will digest itself.
The Automated Teller Machine (ATM) was introduced in England in 1965.
Every time you lick a stamp you consume 1/10 of a calorie.
The Venus's flytrap can eat a whole cheeseburger.
Ancient Egyptians shaved off their eyebrows to mourn the deaths of their cats.
The first toilet ever seen on television was on 'Leave It to Beaver.'

Great Britain was the first county to issue postage stamps. Hence, the postage stamps of Britain are the only stamps in the world not to bear the name of the country of origin. However, every stamp carries a relief image or a silhouette of the monarch's head instead.
A cat uses its whiskers to determine if a space is too small to squeeze through.
A rodents teeth never stop growing. They are worn down by the animal's constant gnawing on bark, leaves, and other vegetables.
A snail can have 25,000 teeth.
Thirty-five percent of the people who use personal ads for dating are already married.
Facetious and abstemious contain all the vowels in the correct order, as does arsenious, meaning containing arsenic.
The Olympic was the sister ship of the Titanic, and she provided twenty-five years of service.
In every episode of Seinfeld there is a Superman somewhere.
There is a city called Rome in every continent.
The surface of the Earth is about 60% water and 10% ice.
Truck driving is the most dangerous occupation by accidental deaths (799 in 2001).
Goethe couldn't stand the sound of barking dogs and could only write if he had an apple rotting in the drawer of his desk.
